intro: Camptoloma rotundifolium, commonly known as the round-leaved camptoloma, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features rounded, hairy leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in dry, sunny habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species in certain areas of southern Europe.
